result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan C Beers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan C Beers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan C Beers was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Bryan C Beers was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bryan C Beers was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent.  Deft sentenced to an additional 54 days KCJ as a condition of probation commencing forthwith.  NOTE - deft has already served 66 days but this time will not be credited towards the time imposed today.  Deft taken into custody.  Huber up to sheriff.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Bond from this file & 15CF559 shall be applied towards financial obligations.  Balance of bond may be returned to poster.
Deft has bond in file 15-CF-559 - to be held

Minutes:  15CF10/15CF559/(16CF652 - FILE NOT IN COURT).  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Cases are resolved.  

15CF10 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1, 3, & 4; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 7/29/16 @ 10:30am.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Deft's bond amended to $1,000 cash (which is already posted).  Court adds an add'l bond condition - deft not to operate a motor vehicle w/o a valid DL.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $129.82.

15CF559 - case dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement w/15CF10.  Bond to be held pending disposition of 15CF10.

16CF652 - case dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement w/15CF10.
